newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER SHOWCASE-PEN PICTURES OF RANGERS PLAYERS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-PEN PICTURES OF RANGERS PLAYERS.

text.p: Pen pictures of Rangers players ahead of Sunday's Scottish premier division match against Glasgow Celtic:

Andy Goram (goalkeeper, age 32). Scotland's first choice goalkeeper with 42 caps to his name. Signed from Hibernian in June 1991 and is currently playing through a course of pain-killers for a rib injury.
Alex Cleland (defender, 26). Versatile defender who has carved out a niche at right-back since joining Rangers in January 1995 from Dundee United.
Alan McLaren (defender, 26). Former Hearts player who moved to Ibrox in October 1994. Missed the first half of the season with a knee injury.

David Robertson (defender, 28). Left-back who loves to push forward down the touchline. Signed from Aberdeen in June 1991. Richard Gough (defender, 34). Central defender and Rangers captain who joined from Tottenham Hotspur for 1.5 million pounds ($2.5 million) in 1987. A regular in the Scottish national side, earning 61 caps, before falling out of favour with manager Craig Brown. Has announced his retirement at the end of this season. Is battling to overcome a calf strain.
Gordan Petric (defender, 27). Imposing Yugoslav-born defender who joined from Dundee United at the start of last season. Ice cool temperament and likes to get forward when he can.

Craig Moore (defender, 21). A graduate of Australia's prestigious Institute of Sport, signed for Rangers in September 1993 and has been on the fringes of the first team since then. Played for Australia's under-21s before gaining his first cap for the Socceroos two season's ago.

Joachim Bjorklund (defender, 25 on Saturday). Tall Swedish defender, the nephew of former Swedish national coach Tommy Svensson, who joined Rangers in the summer from Vicenza. His height is especially needed now there is a doubt over Gough's fitness.

Trevor Steven (midfielder, 33). Talented midfielder capped 36 times for England under Bobby Robson. Part of the exciting Marseille side of the early 1990s, he joined Rangers from the French side for 2.4 million pounds ($4 million) in July 1992 but missed a large chunk of this season through injury.
Paul Gascoigne (midfielder, 29). Never out of the news for long, England's troubled clown though is out of Sunday's match with an ankle injury that will keep him sidelined for two-to- four weeks.

Joerg Albertz (defender/midfielder, 26). Enticed to Rangers from Hamburg for four million pounds ($6.7 million) before the start of the season by the guarantee of Champions' League football. Capped twice for Germany. Likes to push forward and is dangerous from set-pieces. Has scored 12 goals this season.
Ian Ferguson (midfielder, 30 on Saturday). Joined from St Mirren in February 1988. Has made over 250 first team appearances since then, in a career plagued by injury. Capped nine times for Scotland.

Ally McCoist (forward, 34). Now in his 14th season at Ibrox after joining from English club Sunderland, McCoist is Rangers' and Scotland's talismanic striker. With more than 300 goals in over 500 appearances in all competitions he is the top scorer in Rangers' history. Became the Scottish league's record goalscorer in December when he passed Gordon Wallace's mark of 264 goals. Scored 22 goals for St Johnstone in 1980-81 and has scored a record 255 goals for Rangers. Is the club's most capped player with 57 Scottish appearances.

Brian Laudrup (forward, 28). Classy forward with a quick pair of feet and a cool head. Joined from Fiorentina for 2.25 million pounds ($3.8 million) in June 1994 and has more than repaid his transfer fee. Combines well with Gascoigne in Rangers' front line Capped 70 times for Denmark.

Peter Van Vossen (forward, 28). Has yet to establish himself in the Rangers first-team since joining from Istanbul Spor of Turkey but has scored some vital goals after coming on from the substitutes' bench. Former Ajax player.
Erik Bo Andersen (forward, 26). Classic tall centre-forward, who endeared himself to Rangers fans by coming on as a late substitute and scoring twice in Rangers 3-1 win over Celtic on January 2.
